title: Training and Education Division Announces the Graduation of Session 118
body:
Prince George’s County, Maryland…Prince George’s County Police Acting Chief Mark Magaw and Major Mark Persons, Commander of the Training and Education Division, are proud to announce the graduation of fifty-nine (59) recruits from the Prince George’s County Police Department’s Basic Training Session #118.  Fifty-seven (57) of the recruits will join the Prince George’s County Police Department and two (2) will join the Prince George’s County Fire/E.M.S.              Who:               Prince George’s County Executive, The Honorable Rushern L.   Baker, III                        Acting Chief Administrative Officer, Mr. P. Michael Errico                        Clerk of the Circuit Court, The Honorable Marilynn M. Bland                                    Prince George’s County Police Interim Chief, Mark Magaw                        When:             Thursday, May 19, 2011Time:               6:00 p.m.Where:                of                                                                          Upper   Members of the community and the media are invited to attend.  For more information, call the ’s County Police Department’s Press Information Office at (301) 772-4710.
